New Union Realm!

The lands of the Shire and Bree have come together to form the Shire Bree Union. Seen in the major towns across both sides of the Brandywine, Men and Hobbits alike were reportedly holding festivals for many weeks as the news spread. Tremendous food was in abundance, and activities such as pipe smoking were enjoyed by all. This is undoubtedly the start of a new era for the north.

War in the North!

The Lakemwn have decided to break their millenia-old treaty with the Dwarves of Erebor. The Lakemen-Longbeard Treaty of TA 2008 ceded many of the lands north of Dale to the Kingdom of Erebor, to exist as a tributary state to the then-new Dwarven realm. Many speculate as to the reason, but the wise believe it's related to the ever-growing political differences between the realms.

The Third Breakfast
Researchers in the Shire have discovered the Third Breakfast! Hobbits everywhere are in shock and are celebrating.
Salted Pork

Reports of deliciousness are coming from Isengard. The reports, written by a pair of hobbit connoisseurs, claim that "the salted pork is especially good". Dwarves espeecially may be interested in learning more.
Grond!
Grond! Grond! Grond! Grond! Grond! Grond!
Trebuchets
The superior siege weaponry can launch a 200 pound projectile over 300 yards. Is this the future of siege warfare?.
A New Restaurant
A new restaurant has opened up in Mordor. One patron has claimed "looks like meat is back on the menu, boys"!
The Ring of Wormtongue
An interesting theory that Grima Wormtongue had his own ring created for him by his patron. Is this a ring that allows him to control or be controlled?
The Identity of Tom Bombadil
One may ask, who is Tom Bombadil? Some believe he is E√§, a force of creation. Others believe that he is a much more sinister person, the Witch-King of Angmar himself.
The Personality of Gollum

You have heard of the creature of Gollum and his Precious. In the past, Gollum was called Smeagol. Those who have had the Precious for long periods of time have started to display the behaviours and mannerisms of Gollum, suggesting that Gollum may be a personailty that travels with the Precious.
The Question of Frodo's Parents Death

When Frodo was young, his parents died in a boating accident, and he came into the care of his uncle Bilbo, who took Gollum's Precious. All Gollum knew about Bilbo was that his name was Baggins, and that he was a Hobbit of the Shire. Knowing the actions of Gollum, he probably would have killed any Baggins he encountered.
Potato recipes
New recipes revealed for Po-ta-toes. You can boil 'em, mash 'em, even stick 'em in a stew.
On the timeliness of wizards
Recent reports reveal that a wizard is never late, and in fact he arrives precisely when he means to.
Second Breakfast
Reportedly, a pair of Hobbits were travelling with a Man. When they failed to stop for Second Breakfast, the Hobbits were understandably confused.
There and Back Again

In the Shire, a Hobbit by the name of Bilbo Baggins has published a book called There and Back Again. Normally this would not be noteworthy, but this book talks about the adventure in which he took part in. That's odd for a Hobbit.
The Arkenstone, or a Simaril

According to legend, the Arkenstone is no ordinary special gemstone. Rather, it is the Simaril that Maedhros threw into a volcano. The Dwarves, with their most skilled craftsmen, were able to reshape it into the Arkenstone, the King's Jewel.
A New Trade Route
With the opening of the new route between Hobbiton and Isengard, the Shire and the Wizard's Domain are better connected than ever, allowing for easier taking the Hobbits to Isengard!
Tarlang the Giant

In the distant past, Tarlang the Giant was attempting to build a wall to keep Men out of his people's lands. While carrying a bag of rocks, he fell on his face, breaking his neck. The giants left him there, and used his body as part of the wall. The three mountains of Tarlang the region - Dol Tarlang, C√ªl Veleg and C√ªl B√Æn - are his head, and remnants of his rock load respectively.

Is it Racist to Criticize Orcs for eating Man-flesh?

Is it racist to criticize orcs for eating Man-flesh? Clearly it is. The oppression of the Elves has led to starvation across Orc settlements, and out of desperation, many Orcs have turned to alternative food sources. For those who find it atrocious that some Orcs live this way, the best way to solve this is to stop the oppression of the Elves!
Apologies from the editor
The editor of this fine publications offers its sincere apologies for the mistake in last week's issue. When we said "Turd Age", we meant "Third Age". We offer our sincerest regrets.
Baseless speculation on noble families

It's a slow news day so we're going to baselessly speculate on the marriages and relationships of our nation's nobles. Who hates who? Who is marrying who? Who is planning on fleeing the country? More inside.
Dog bites a child

column2: The weather
Probabilities for the next week: Some sunshine, some clouds, some rain, and if you're unlucky enough, some ash clouds.
Law discussed
Lawyers from all over the country convened today in $OURCAPITAL$ to discuss eventual updates to the country's code in matters of civil and criminal law.
The history of $OURCOUNTRY$
A definitive multivolume work on the history of the $OURCOUNTRY_ADJ$ civilization has finally been completed. Historians proclaim it the greatest reference yet, true to our heroic deeds.
Blacksmith dead
A blacksmith was kicked to death by a horse he was attempting to shoe in $ANYPROVINCE$ yesterday.
Hoarde uncovered
The remnants of an old coin hoard were found in $ANYPROVINCE$ this week. Many pieces of golden coinage were discovered by a farmer plowing a field after heavy rain.
Ship sank
News from the coast of a vicious ship sinking with all hands lost. Reasons for the complete loss of the ship are currently unknown.
Cat rescued
A cat that was stuck in a tree in $ANYPROVINCE$ was rescued after hours of efforts by local authorities.
Public Service Announcement
PSA from local authorities in $ANYPROVINCE$: Wargs are not pets, do not attempt to feed, stroke, or hug these dangerous animals.
Tariffs are good!
A government official in $ANYPROVINCE$ has espoused the benefits of tariffs: "it's the most beautiful word in the dictionary!"
Salacious sofa scandal
A local government employee in $ANYPROVINCE$ has been caught having extramarital affairs with a piece of upholstery.
Government plans leaked!
The editor of this newspaper was apparently accidentally included in a group letter detailing the future plans of this government.
Exclusive inside scoop!
Read the latest updates on things that were, things that are, and some things that have not yet come to pass.
What exactly is pipeweed?
What exactly is the Halflings' Leaf? Though some posit that it is merely a relaxant, others argue that it does indeed make you chase dragons.
Ravens are not pets
A reader from the Lonely Mountain wishes to remind everyone that ravens are not pets. They are in fact highly intelligent and an occasional nuisance.
Dance festival in Barad-d√ªr
A rave of dancing and debauchery held recently during a festival in Barad-d√ªr has been described by onlookers as "Mordor on the dancefloor".
Noise complaint
Authorities in $ANYPROVINCE$ have received noise complaints after riders have been seen and heard charging around screaming "DEATH". Officials are investigating.
Penguins must pay
A government official has declared 10% tariffs will be placed on an cold, desolate, uninhabited island on the other side of the world. Apparently, the calculated trade balance was too one sided.
Small time scandal
News from a $ANYPROVINCE$ of a scandal involving local government officials. More on this story as it developers.
ROBBERY!

Businesses in $ANYPROVINCE$ have been hit by a string of robberies by a masked gang of ne'er-do-wells. The police are searching for the criminals and is granting a reward for any information leading to their capture.
Storm unlikely
Incoming weather reports indicate that a storm is unlikely to hit $OURCOUNTRY$ because the weather system does not support it.
Masked vigilante strikes
Lately our capital has seen crime-fighting actions by a lone individual in feline dress styling himself 'The Catman', repelling sharks as he goes.
Long summer
Loremasters in $OURCAPITAL$ have suggested that the incoming summer is expected to be long, but some of the smallfolk believe a long summer means a longer winter.
Broken toe
A soldier in $ANYPROVINCE$ has reportedly broken his toe kicking a helmet. The scream of agony was understandably very convincing.
The correct sound of a backstab
A troupe of actors visiting $ANYPROVINCE$ have wowed onlookers with their extremely and concerningly accurate portrayal of being stabbed in the back.
Isengard prophecy
We note an ancient prophecy regarding Isengard: Orthanc will never be vanquished, until the Old Forest remove to the River Isen, come against it.
A difference between man and orc
One noted different between the races of man and the races of orc: armies of man march to a 4/4 time signature, orcs to 5/4.
Dwarf banned from menagerie
A dwarf was caught and banned from a zoo after somehow obtaining the eyes of a hawk and the ears of the fox. He was found due to his loud breathing and detained by authorities.
